description: Pixen users can create and save custom PXBGND files to maintain a consistent editing environment across multiple projects. For example, a user working on tile-based artwork can set a checkerboard pattern as the background to distinguish transparent areas easily, then save that setup as a PXBGND file for reuse. These files help streamline the editing process by allowing artists to quickly switch between different visual backgrounds tailored to specific tasks or preferences.

To create a PXBGND file with the Pro version of Pixen, select Window â†’ Backgrounds Library , click the + button, and select a starting template from Flat, Checkerboard, Slashed, or Image types. You can then customize the backgrounds.
